S.M. Sertaz Islam is a medical entomologist in the Department of Parasitology at [Sylhet Agricultural University](https://sau.ac.bd/faculty/faculty_home/124). Their academic work focuses on vector ecology, antimicrobial resistance (AMR), and sustainable energy, with particular emphasis on the ecological and environmental drivers of vector-borne diseases. Through interdisciplinary research, they investigate vector dynamics, resistance mechanisms, and sustainable strategies for vector management and public health improvement. In addition to entomology and parasitology, their interest in sustainable energy reflects a commitment to environmentally responsible, health-integrated development solutions. Sertaz Islam actively contributes to research, collaboration, and scholarly dissemination at the intersection of ecology, health, and sustainability.
